Posts.Content: May 28, 2013 05:12PM Airianna23 wrote: Thank you SouthernAngel. I hope all is well with your biopsy results. You'll post them right? How old are your little ones? It's hard to push it out of my mind at night because there are no distractions. I'm reminding myself there are lots of things it could be besides cancer. My husband finally understood today when I explained how draining it is to have these worrisome symptoms and all people say is "Don't worry it's nothing." or "I bet it's just (fill in the blank)." I think it's best for me to just not talk about it until I know for sure.
Posts.Title: Was referred to a Breast Specialist today (rambling vent post) Airianna23 Southernangel

Posts.Content: Airianna23 wrote: I had my follow up with my OBGYN and she's sending me to a Breast Specialist (or surgeon- I can't remember which she said).  I'm really scared.  She said the lump feels like it's changed and my nipple has retracted more.  She said something is pulling my nipple area inwards.  I started crying and she said she doesn't think it's cancer.  I had a mammo & us but they didn't show anything.  Not a cyst, plugged duct, nothing.  Everyone can feel the lump and see the changes in my breast though. My OBGYN then started me on antibiotics thinking it may be an infection but today she told me it's not.  She basically said she has no idea, maybe it could be my implants, but the mammo showed they are perfectly intact and they are also under the muscle so they shouldn't really be causing an issue like this. I called my OBGYN just now to see if she can send me for an MRI before I go see the specialist, that way I won't have to wait so long.  I'm very scared. I had to have my 2 yr old with me at the appointment and he sat on my lap when I was on the exam table.  I feel so bad cuz he got scared when I had to lay back.  I keep seeing him in my head with his little arms strectched out and his face looking very worried and him saying "Mama! No Mama!".  I'm so scared that I have cancer and since I'm young it's the more aggressive kind. It's been like 2 or 3 months since I fist noticed the nipple change/lump. What if it's advanced?  I can't not raise my son.  He's everything to me and he deserves to have a mommy. My friends/family keep saying it's nothing, it's impossible that it's cancer, etc. etc.  But it's actually MORE draining to hear that.  I feel like I have to re-explain to people my symptoms and justify the fact that I'm going to the Doctor. Anyway I'm just venting... Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Was referred to a Breast Specialist today (rambling vent post) Airianna23 Southernangel

Posts.Content: May 17, 2013 02:13AM Airianna23 wrote: Hi Bhelson,  I don't have any experience in seeing mammograms or US, I just wanted to say good luck and I hope it's benign.  I'm 30 as well and scheduled to have a mammo/us tomorrow for a lump.  Mine's painful as well. I hope they find out what's causing this for us and get us some relief!
Posts.Title: Look at my Mammogram image Read my story...can anyone relate?? bhelson krssy11

Posts.Content: Jun 6, 2013 11:27PM Airianna23 wrote: Mammograms miss about 20% of cancers AND they also miss benign conditions. My mammo & US couldn't see my lump even though we could feel it. My surgeon sent me for a 2nd US & this time they saw it. I'm getting a biopsy and frankly, you should be getting one too. From what I understand, if you have discharge, that can be biopsied as well. It's most likely not cancer for either of us, but a biopsy is the only way to know for sure. Contact a breast surgeon or your dr and ask for one.
Posts.Title: Mammogram NEGATIVE but still have symptoms mshaw6273 ondang2

Posts.Content: Jun 10, 2013 11:46PM Airianna23 wrote: Could you maybe have your doctor do another peer to peer review- only this time for insurance to approve a biopsy?
Posts.Title: Still Unknown azrescue azrescue

Posts.Content: Airianna23 wrote: So I've posted here before. I'm 30, found a hard lump under my left areola, about the size of a pinhead. This was about 3 months ago. Since then it hasn't really grown, but the tissue around it has gotten harder. And my nipple has retracted more noticeably. After 1 mammo & 2 US's, I'm finally scheduled for a surgical biopsy in 2 weeks. But I'm scared that's too long to wait. I'm very thankful to have the surgery, but I've read women's stories olive where the cancer spread quickly. I'm scared that not only will it be cancer, but that by having to wait & do so many tests b4 a biopsy that it'll have spread. Especially cuz I'm 30 & in younger women cancer is more aggressive. I'm fine all day, but every night I cry thinking that I'm wasting valuable time & the cancer is going to spread through my body and take me away from my baby & husband. I'm being neurotic cuz there's been no diagnosis yet but I can't help it. I know this is mostly nervousness, but I can't sleep cuz I'm so worried! Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: May 29, 2013 09:03AM Airianna23 wrote: First off, don't worry about coming off as a hypocondriach! It's your health and it's better to  be proactive.  If the mammo & us came back clear that's a great sign.  But if you still have suspicious symptoms I don't see the point in waiting till November.  Ask your doctor for an MRI.  And maybe they can biopsy the area where the thickening is.  I'm not sure, but definitely tell your doctor your symptoms and specifically state you don't want to wait until November and would like further testing done now. That being said, it could just be you never saw yourself braless, at that particular angle, in that particular lighting.  Have you gained or lost weight recently?
